meanings.definition: The branch of technology that deals with dimensions and tolerances of less than 100 nanometers, especially the manipulation of individual atoms and molecules.
meanings.sent1: Scientists are exploring nanotechnologies to understand and control matter at the smallest scale.
meanings.sent2: Nanotechnologies have revolutionized the field of electronics by enabling the development of smaller and more efficient devices.
meanings.sent3: The tiny robots in the sci-fi movie used advanced nanotechnologies to repair spaceships in seconds.
meanings.sent4: In the futuristic world of the novel, nanotechnologies were the key to creating self-repairing structures.
meanings.sent5: The potential of nanotechnologies to transform medicine is truly remarkable.

meanings.definition: The application of nanoscience to create new technologies and materials.
meanings.sent1: Companies invest in nanotechnologies to enhance the performance of their products.
meanings.sent2: The development of nanotechnologies has led to breakthroughs in various industries.
meanings.sent3: The fashion designer used nanotechnologies to design a fabric that changes color in sunlight.
meanings.sent4: Her creativity soared when she experimented with the possibilities of nanotechnologies.
meanings.sent5: The potential uses of nanotechnologies seem endless in the realm of innovation.
